did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes documentation of his work for The Centre for Local Economic Strategies, a non-profit membership organization of Labour local governments; writing for the Local Economic Development Information System of The Planning Exchange, based in Glasgow; and government and non-profit agency documents describing local and regional economic development efforts.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Peter Meyer is professor emeritus of Urban Policy and Economics at the University of Louisville. In the 1980s, he did research in Britain on comparing local economic development strategies in Leeds, Cardiff, and Glasgow. The Centre for

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes documentation of his work for The Centre for Local Economic Strategies, a non-profit membership organization of Labour local governments; writing for the Local Economic Development Information System of The Planning Exchange, based in Glasgow; and government and non-profit agency documents describing local and regional economic development efforts.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: British Labour local authority archives, #6799. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
